You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!

body:
[DGKSK8LIFE](https://ruqqus.com/@DGKSK8LIFE), banned for "staff impersonation" (I don't know when he was banned)

Note: I don't have the full story. I tried looking on the Discord, but that was after they had already hidden/deleted the old lounge channel, so there wasn't much I could find.

On discord, captainmeta4 says this in reply to a message by CrystalVulpine that I wasn't able to find.

>DGK was banned on ruqqus because they wrote in their ruqqus bio that they were a "member of the core ruqqus team". This is a very straightforward and clearcut violation of the ToS, which prohibits admin impersonation

According to Moister Banana#2942 on Discord, he said he was a part of the "Core Ruqqus Team", but he was not. According to CrystalVulpine, he *was* a part of the core ruqqus team. (I can't confirm what either of these users have said.)

CrystalVulpine said that he had "write access to the repo", and acikek said that "he technically was [an official ruqqus dev]" and that "the core ruqqus team was loosely defined anyways". Both these users say the real reason the admins wanted to ban him was because of fights they've had in the past.

Moister Banana#2942 says that he was asked to remove the section where he said he was a dev before getting banned, while [CrystalVulpine says that they barely gave him enough time to do it after he was removed from the dev team](https://ruqqus.com/+PoliticalCompassMemes/post/3whf/the-state-of-ruqqus/dfie).

(He was also apparently an edgelord, but that's irrelevant here.)

Either way, I don't know the full story, but it sounds like the ban was a bit too harsh, much like [the ban of jasonkhanlar](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/38lp/regarding-the-bans-of-jasonkhanlar-and). I don't think that this should have warranted a permanent ban from both Ruqqus and the Ruqqus Discord.

On discord, captainmeta4 says this in reply to a message by CrystalVulpine that I wasn't able to find.

DGK was banned on ruqqus because they wrote in their ruqqus bio that they were a "member of the core ruqqus team". This is a very straightforward and clearcut violation of the ToS, which prohibits admin impersonation

According to Moister Banana#2942 on Discord, he said he was a part of the "Core Ruqqus Team", but he was not. According to CrystalVulpine, he was a part of the core ruqqus team. (I can't confirm what either of these users have said.)

CrystalVulpine said that he had "write access to the repo", and acikek said that "he technically was [an official ruqqus dev]" and that "the core ruqqus team was loosely defined anyways". Both these users say the real reason the admins wanted to ban him was because of fights they've had in the past.

Moister Banana#2942 says that he was asked to remove the section where he said he was a dev before getting banned, while CrystalVulpine says that they barely gave him enough time to do it after he was removed from the dev team.

(He was also apparently an edgelord, but that's irrelevant here.)

Either way, I don't know the full story, but it sounds like the ban was a bit too harsh, much like the ban of jasonkhanlar. I don't think that this should have warranted a permanent ban from both Ruqqus and the Ruqqus Discord.

body:
This post doesn't show up in /all?sort=new for logged out users, but I don't know why. This guild has not opted out of /all.

Edit: [Found the reason](https://ruqqus.com/+OtherChanges/post/56tz/posts-containing-political-content-no-longer). I linked to +PoliticalCompassMemes in my post.
body_html:
This post doesn't show up in /all?sort=new for logged out users, but I don't know why. This guild has not opted out of /all.

Edit: Found the reason. I linked to +PoliticalCompassMemes in my post.
